entries.meaning: The world or realm of centaurs.
examples: Labelled 'the most famous and wisest of all the centaurs' by one commentator, Chiron represented the acceptable face of centaurdom.

entries.meaning: The condition of being, or resembling, a centaur.
examples: Byron, who mocked the institution of the haremlik in Don Juan, saw little to distinguish the horrors of Muslim treatment of women from those of the Christian moral centaurdom of marriage.
